comments:
I have a csv file.The first line has column name and the next line has data type.After this i have comma separated values.

After the values I have a new line then again i have column name(for second table) and then data type and again comma separated values.

For example

CustomerName,CustomerAge
STRING,INT
a,1,
b,2,
c,3

CustomerGroup,CustomerIncome
STRING,INT
A1,12,
A2,23,
A3,34


Now a am doing a query 
select CustomerName, CustomerAge from {filenmae} for first the data set.

and 
select CustomerGroup, CustomerIncome from {filenmae} for second  the data set.

But i am getting the exception when i run my {designfile}.rptdesign through BIRT engine.It is coming even if i use only one data set .

Exception is

Note:
This format works properly for excel sheets.

This is an enhancement for flatfile ODA to two data tables in on one CSV file.

The work around would be to split these two tables into two different CSV files and define one dataset for each.

lastly, please look into the source code of the flatfile ODA driver and see if you can modify it to meet your need.

Actually the tailing comma leads to the exception.Furthermore, the current implementation of flat file driver only accept .csv files which host one and only one table.

The following is the correct format of the .csv file:

----file1.csv-----
CustomerName,CustomerAge
STRING,INT
a,1
b,2
c,3

----file2.csv-----
CustomerGroup,CustomerIncome
STRING,INT
A1,12
A2,23
A3,34
This bug is actually caused by using invalid csv file. Invalidate it as appropriate.

traces.message: The DataSet bound to the chart returned no rows.
The DataSet bound to the chart returned no rows.
